title: Long COVID, Cognitive Impairment, and the Stalled Decline in Disability Rates
description: Long COVID encompasses a suite of long-term symptoms that commonly include fatigue, shortness of breath, and so-called brain fog, along with many others. Individuals with long-term symptoms may be unable to work (or work full-time) as a result of their condition, and there is growing speculation that long COVID may be restraining labor supply.
dc:creator: Price, Brendan M.
